page.title: 08Folk Customs Class 4
page.content: {Staining Gala} photographic evidence for 1895. In 1912 called Hardhorn & Newton Children's Field Day. Horsedrawn floats, Children's holiday. Mrs Perkins organiser. Ceased at start of WW2 In 49 restarted. Food coupons needed for teas >1950 on Saturdays. 1977 Earnshaws gave new field 1/4 ml from original site. 1970s renamed Normoss & Staining Gala Cost in 1923 - 1300p, by 1985 - 120000p {St Luke's May Queen} begun in 1976 to raise money as day school moved from church into new building next door. All Sunday School children take part. Queen is ~ 11yrs old and from a church going family. After crowning by local person crowd entertained by children with May Pole & country dances, songs and poems. Then stalls, sideshows, raffles & games precede a grand tea. The money raised is used for the Sunday School. Event held Sat nearest Rogation Sunday.
